name: Chicken Fajita Bowl
description: Mexican-inspired bowl with colorful peppers and spiced chicken. A protein-packed, vibrant meal.

instructions.instruction: Rinse brown rice and cook with 2.5 cups water for 20-25 minutes.
Mix fajita seasoning: cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
Coat chicken strips thoroughly with the seasoning.
instructions.tip: Slice chicken thin and even for quick cooking.

instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in a large pan over high heat.
Add seasoned chicken to the pan. Cook for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove chicken and set aside. Add peppers and onion to the same pan.
Sauté vegetables for 4-5 minutes. Keep them slightly crisp.
instructions.tip: Don't overcook - colors should stay vibrant.

instructions.instruction: Cut avocado in half and slice.
Top with chicken, sautéed peppers, black beans, corn, and avocado.
Add yogurt and lime wedges. Serve hot.

tips: Black beans add extra fiber and protein.
Store-bought fajita seasoning works, but homemade is healthier.
Bowls can be prepped ahead and refrigerated.
For keto, skip the rice and double the vegetables.
storageInfo: Store avocado and yogurt separately. Keeps for 3-4 days refrigerated.
servingSuggestion: Serve with tortilla chips or warm tortillas on the side.
variations: Beef or shrimp also work great.
Use tofu for a vegetarian version.
